description: From hand +â€Ž bag. The music genre is named from women dancing around a pile of their handbags in nightclubs. The verb is a reference to Margaret Thatcher's handbag.

entries.meaning: (mainly Commonwealth) A small bag used by women (or sometimes by men) for carrying various small personal items.

verbs.description: handbag (third-person singular simple present handbags, present participle handbagging, simple past and past participle handbagged)

entries.meaning: (Britain, transitive, humorous) To attack verbally or subject to criticism (typically used of a woman).
